results.abstract: K Feoktistov, member of 3-man Voskhod launched in '64, hints new type of manned spacecraft which could leave earth, land on another planet and return without discarding carrier rockets may be under construction, article in Science and Life (pub)

headline.main: A New Type of Spacecraft Discussed in Soviet Article

results.snippet: MOSCOW, Sept. 30 (AP)-- A Soviet astronaut wrote today of a new type of spacecraft that could start directly from the earth, land on another planet and return to earth without having to discard such large parts as carrier rocket stages.
results.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Sept. 30 (AP)-- A Soviet astronaut wrote today of a new type of spacecraft that could start directly from the earth, land on another planet and return to earth without having to discard such large parts as carrier rocket stages.

headline.main: Soviet Celebrates 10th Anniversary of Space Age; Pledges to 'Storm the Skies to Reach Moon and Planets Tribute Is Paid to Astronaut Killed in Soyuz 1 Crash

results.snippet: MOSCOW, Oct. 3 (UPI) The Soviet Union celebrated today the 10th anniversary of the space age, and it paid tribute to the only known Russian astronaut victim Col. Vladimir M. Komarov.
results.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Oct. 3 (UPI) The Soviet Union celebrated today the 10th anniversary of the space age, and it paid tribute to the only known Russian astronaut victim Col. Vladimir M. Komarov.

results.abstract: Astronaut Maj C C Williams Jr killed as T-38 crashes near Ga-Fla border

headline.main: Astronaut Is Killed As T-38 Jet Plane Crashes in Florida

results.snippet: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Oct. 5 (AP) One of the nation's astronauts, Marine Maj. Clifton C. Williams Jr., was killed today when his T-38 jet plane smashed into a wooded area in Florida near the Georgia border and exploded.
results.lead_paragraph: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Oct. 5 (AP) One of the nation's astronauts, Marine Maj. Clifton C. Williams Jr., was killed today when his T-38 jet plane smashed into a wooded area in Florida near the Georgia border and exploded.

headline.main: ASTRONAUT FAILED IN ATTEMPT TO EJECT

results.snippet: TALLAHASSEE, Oct. 6 (UPI) Space officials disclosed to-  day that moments before Maj. Clifton. C. Williams Jr., an Apollo astronaut, rode to his death in his jet trainer yesterday he radioed that he was ejecting.
results.lead_paragraph: TALLAHASSEE, Oct. 6 (UPI) Space officials disclosed to- day that moments before Maj. Clifton. C. Williams Jr., an Apollo astronaut, rode to his death in his jet trainer yesterday he radioed that he was ejecting.

results.abstract: Col McDivitt urges use of scientific tech to aid underdeveloped nations, s, Rome

headline.main: CATHOLICS URGED TO CONDEMN BIAS; U.S. Negro Asks Meeting of Laymen to Brand It a Sin

results.snippet: ROME, Oct. 12--An American Negro delegate urged the third World Congress for the Lay Apostolate today to brand racial discrimination a sin or face the threat of "spiritual dissolution."
results.lead_paragraph: ROME, Oct. 12--An American Negro delegate urged the third World Congress for the Lay Apostolate today to brand racial discrimination a sin or face the threat of "spiritual dissolution."

headline.main: A Navigation Computer for the Astronaut; New Yorker Obtains Patent on Device to Fix Position Wide Variety of Ideas Covered By Patents Issued During Week

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20--A New York safety engineer, who has recorded more than 400 observations of the sun and stars to check his calculations, was granted a patent this week on a navigation comnuter for astronauts.

byline.original: By STACY V.JONES Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20--A New York safety engineer, who has recorded more than 400 observations of the sun and stars to check his calculations, was granted a patent this week on a navigation comnuter for astronauts.

results.lead_paragraph: CLINTON, N.Y., Oct 21-- Miss Nancy Lane Rogers, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Philip V. Rogers of Clinton and Edgartown, Mass., was married in the Hamilton College Chapel at noon today to John Bradford Burghardt Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. John Burghardt of Ridgewood, N.J.

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 29-- Official sources here said today the Soviet Union had asked a number of countries for permission to rescue astronauts who might land in their territory after a trip to the moon.

byline.original: By EVERT CLARK Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 29-- Official sources here said today the Soviet Union had asked a number of countries for permission to rescue astronauts who might land in their territory after a trip to the moon.

results.abstract: automatic docking seen practice maneuver for manned lunar flight and test of communication, navigation and control systems that malfunctioned on Soyuz I flight

headline.main: U.S. Expert Calls Automatic Docking by Soviet Practice for a Lunar Test

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 30 The Soviet Union practiced today many of the space maneuvers that it would have to master to put men on the moon and return them to earth, officials here said.

byline.original: By EVERT CLARK Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 30 The Soviet Union practiced today many of the space maneuvers that it would have to master to put men on the moon and return them to earth, officials here said.

results.abstract: Cosmos 186 and Cosmos 188 automatically docked in space for 3V4 hrs; 1st unmanned docking and 1st USSR space docking; details; feat achieved by 'space radio-technical means and on-board computers'; Tass says mission clears way for creation of huge scientific space stations; observers see link-up as preparation for manned space flight; M Keldysh denies plan; unconfirmed repts Cosmos 186 was large enough to carry crew of 5; Tass repts spacecrafts after docking orbited at alts of '25-171 mi and circled earth every 88-97 mins

headline.main: 2 RUSSIAN CRAFT LINKED IN ORBIT; BOTH UNMANNED; 3 -Hour Docking Exercise Called Prelude to Creation of Large Space Stations TECHNICAL FEAT HAILED Soviet Science Chief Notes Approach Systems and Complicated Maneuvers 2 RUSSIAN CRAFT LINKED IN ORBIT

results.snippet: MOSCOW, Oct. 30 Two unmanned Soviet space satellites docked in orbit today and flew together for three and a half hours before resuming their separate paths. It was the first unmanned docking and the first Soviet space docking.

byline.original: By HENRY KAMM Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Oct. 30 Two unmanned Soviet space satellites docked in orbit today and flew together for three and a half hours before resuming their separate paths. It was the first unmanned docking and the first Soviet space docking.
